document.discussion_title: Charles Schwab Corp’s (SCHW) Buy Rating Reaffirmed at Jefferies Group
document.topic_text: Tweet Charles Schwab Corp (NASDAQ:SCHW) ‘s stock had its “buy” rating reiterated by investment analysts at Jefferies Group in a research report issued on Monday, AnalystRatingsNetwork.com reports. Charles Schwab Corp ( NASDAQ:SCHW ) traded down 0.77% during midday trading on Monday, hitting $29.49. The stock had a trading volume of 2,891,651 shares. The stock has a market cap of $38.94 billion and a price-to-earnings ratio of 28.63. Charles Schwab Corp has a 12 month low of $21.51 and a 12 month high of $35.72. The stock has a 50 day moving average of $27.91 and a 200 day moving average of $28.99. Charles Schwab Corp (NASDAQ:SCHW) last released its quarterly earnings results on Friday, April 15th. The company reported $0.29 EPS for the quarter, hitting analysts’ consensus estimates of $0.29. During the same quarter last year, the business earned $0.22 EPS. The company had revenue of $1.76 billion for the quarter. The company’s quarterly revenue was up 15.6% compared to the same quarter last year. Analysts expect that Charles Schwab Corp will post $1.26 EPS for the current fiscal year. The firm also recently announced a quarterly dividend, which will be paid on Friday, May 27th. Investors of record on Friday, May 13th will be paid a dividend of $0.07 per share. The ex-dividend date of this dividend is Wednesday, May 11th. This is an increase from Charles Schwab Corp’s previous quarterly dividend of $0.06. This represents a $0.28 dividend on an annualized basis and a yield of 0.95%. A number of other research firms also recently commented on SCHW. Deutsche Bank restated a “buy” rating on shares of Charles Schwab Corp in a research report on Sunday, March 20th. Goldman Sachs dropped their price target on shares of Charles Schwab Corp from $38.00 to $37.00 in a research report on Tuesday, January 12th. JPMorgan Chase & Co. restated a “buy” rating and set a $34.00 price target (down from $35.00) on shares of Charles Schwab Corp in a research report on Thursday, April 14th. Nomura upgraded shares of Charles Schwab Corp from a “neutral” rating to a “buy” rating and set a $34.00 price target on the stock in a research report on Monday, January 25th. Finally, Wells Fargo restated a “hold” rating on shares of Charles Schwab Corp in a research report on Wednesday, March 16th. Nine research analysts have rated the stock with a hold rating and eleven have issued a buy rating to the company. The stock presently has a consensus rating of “Buy” and a consensus price target of $34.06. Several institutional investors have modified their holdings of SCHW. Capital Investment Advisors LLC boosted its position in shares of Charles Schwab Corp by 1.5% in the first quarter. Capital Investment Advisors LLC now owns 10,225 shares of the company’s stock valued at $286,000 after buying an additional 154 shares in the last quarter. Forte Capital LLC ADV boosted its position in shares of Charles Schwab Corp by 1.7% in the first quarter. Forte Capital LLC ADV now owns 13,186 shares of the company’s stock valued at $369,000 after buying an additional 225 shares in the last quarter. Essex Investment Management Co. LLC boosted its position in shares of Charles Schwab Corp by 0.4% in the fourth quarter. Essex Investment Management Co. LLC now owns 60,732 shares of the company’s stock valued at $2,000,000 after buying an additional 259 shares in the last quarter. West Coast Financial LLC boosted its position in shares of Charles Schwab Corp by 0.3% in the fourth quarter. West Coast Financial LLC now owns 91,279 shares of the company’s stock valued at $3,006,000 after buying an additional 267 shares in the last quarter. Finally, Gradient Investments LLC boosted its position in shares of Charles Schwab Corp by 3.0% in the first quarter. Gradient Investments LLC now owns 12,085 shares of the company’s stock valued at $339,000 after buying an additional 357 shares in the last quarter. In other news, major shareholder Charles R. Schwab sold 560,000 shares of the firm’s stock in a transaction that occurred on Thursday, April 21st. The shares were sold at an average price of $29.02, for a total transaction of $16,251,200.00. The sale was disclosed in a legal filing with the Securities & Exchange Commission, which can be accessed through this link . Also, EVP Bernard J. Clark sold 10,073 shares of the firm’s stock in a transaction that occurred on Thursday, March 3rd. The stock was sold at an average price of $26.64, for a total transaction of $268,344.72. The disclosure for this sale can be found here . The Charles Schwab Corporation ( NASDAQ:SCHW ) is a savings and loan holding company. Through its subsidiaries, the Company engages in wealth management, securities brokerage, banking, money management and financial advisory services.
